extended_event_descriptor.text: Take an epic look at the phenomenal mountain ranges of North and South America, as stunning HD pictures reveal their untamed beauty.
Scientists attempt to trap, collar and study the elusive and beautiful big cat, in spite of its habitat being part of a war zone.
Why are Africa's predators so drawn to prey that can kill them? Lions tackle huge buffalo while the honey badger hunts venomous snakes.
See animals which change colour and shape to fool or trap their enemies when they attack prey or defend themselves.
A pair of giraffes battle viciously for dominance, a fisherman is caught by feeding alligators, and a buffalo tosses a lion like a rag doll.
When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, from heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses.

Travel through the majestic Primeval forests of the Urals. This Russian sanctuary is a land of extremes where giant deer, half-tonne leviathans and tiny adventures flourish. Eurasian elk make seasonal journeys in search of food. Unlike other deer, Eu
A pair of giraffes battle viciously for dominance, a fisherman is caught by feeding alligators, and a buffalo tosses a lion like a rag doll.
When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, from heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses.
See animals which change colour and shape to fool or trap their enemies when they attack prey or defend themselves.
Fearsome teeth and claws are standard issue for many animals, but a small band of elite warriors have upgraded their natural armaments.
A pair of giraffes battle viciously for dominance, a fisherman is caught by feeding alligators, and a buffalo tosses a lion like a rag doll.
When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, from heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses.

Why are Africa's predators so drawn to prey that can kill them? Lions tackle huge buffalo while the honey badger hunts venomous snakes.
Scientists attempt to trap, collar and study the elusive and beautiful big cat, in spite of its habitat being part of a war zone.
As Arctic ice melt, orcas are moving into the region's seas and contending with the existing apex predators, polar bears and inuit, for seals
Fearsome teeth and claws are standard issue for many animals, but a small band of elite warriors have upgraded their natural armaments.
A pair of giraffes battle viciously for dominance, a fisherman is caught by feeding alligators, and a buffalo tosses a lion like a rag doll.
When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, from heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses.
Learn the truth behind Africa's most feared snake as cameras capture previously unseen behaviour
Poison is a terrifying weapon for attack or defence. The venom of ten lethal creatures is compared in a bid to find the deadliest.
Scotland's Hebrides are Europe's final frontier against the unpredictable Atlantic. Ewan McGregor narrates the story of animal life there.
A pair of giraffes battle viciously for dominance, a fisherman is caught by feeding alligators, and a buffalo tosses a lion like a rag doll.
When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, from heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses.
With cutting-edge visual effects, experts discuss the adaptations possible extreme scenarios might bring about in the big cats
Equipped with deadly weapons and a bad attitude, the cobra family is feared throughout Africa and Asia. Explore their diverse abilities.
Carnivorous fish team up against a river rat, a mother bear defends her cubs by any means necessary, and killer whales live up to their name.
One dog swims to exhaustion to be with his dolphin friend, while another gives comfort to an abandoned bear. Cesar Millan explains it all.
Threats this time range from small stingers to mouths full of punishingly sharp teeth.
At the roof of the world and on the edge of civilization sits the Russian Arctic, known for its extreme temperatures, weather and hostility.
See the goose that cheers a retiree in an LA park, a seal who won't eat without her vet, and a deer who thinks two people and a cat make a herd.
Threats this time range from small stingers to mouths full of punishingly sharp teeth.
Carnivorous fish team up against a river rat, a mother bear defends her cubs by any means necessary, and killer whales live up to their name.
Poison is a terrifying weapon for attack or defence. The venom of ten lethal creatures is compared in a bid to find the deadliest.
Meet a wild fawn who is friends with a dog, an autistic boy helped by chickens, and a cat and rat who've overcome expectations
Threats this time range from small stingers to mouths full of punishingly sharp teeth.
At the roof of the world and on the edge of civilization sits the Russian Arctic, known for its extreme temperatures, weather and hostility.
Equipped with deadly weapons and a bad attitude, the cobra family is feared throughout Africa and Asia. Explore their diverse abilities.
With cutting-edge visual effects, experts discuss the adaptations possible extreme scenarios might bring about in the big cats
Learn the truth behind Africa's most feared snake as cameras capture previously unseen behaviour
Poison is a terrifying weapon for attack or defence. The venom of ten lethal creatures is compared in a bid to find the deadliest.
Meet a wild fawn who is friends with a dog, an autistic boy helped by chickens, and a cat and rat who've overcome expectations
Threats this time range from small stingers to mouths full of punishingly sharp teeth.
Brown hyena expert Ingrid Wiesel seeks her favourite study animal, Tosca, who has disappeared from her home range on Namibia's west coast.
Some animals find strength in numbers: swarms of hundreds, thousands, millions or more. Some convene for feeding; others, mating
Scotland's Hebrides are Europe's final frontier against the unpredictable Atlantic. Ewan McGregor narrates the story of animal life there.
Meet a wild fawn who is friends with a dog, an autistic boy helped by chickens, and a cat and rat who've overcome expectations
Threats this time range from small stingers to mouths full of punishingly sharp teeth.
Footage of a lion versus cheetah fight sheds new light on the relationship between these extraordinary big cats.
This shrew employs echolocation like a bat and uses venom like a snake, but must also eat every two hours to stay alive.
Golden sands and crystalline waters may look idyllic, but even in such beautiful settings animals must fight for territory and life.
Meet the planet's top carnivores. Stealthy, fierce or armed with deadly natural weapons, all have the skills to kill.
Lurking in our homes are tiny monsters feasting on human blood. Exterminators show the tactics which eliminate these rapidly multiplying pests.
Visit the deep and enchanting Ussuriland forest, featuring an array of fascinating creatures including two rare and endangered species of cat

An action-packed look at key moments in the struggles for survival and supremacy within the animal kingdom.
Tables can be turned on predators when their intended meals fight back. See how crocodiles, lions and sharks deal with these sudden reversals.
From stealthy cats to patient seals, giant centipedes and kick-boxing kangaroos, a look at animals that use stealth to their advantage.
Polar bears and giraffes are among animals fervently defending territory and mates. Sand-tiger sharks are even competitive before birth.
See animals which change colour and shape to fool or trap their enemies when they attack prey or defend themselves.
Carnivorous fish team up against a river rat, a mother bear defends her cubs by any means necessary, and killer whales live up to their name.
Golden sands and crystalline waters may look idyllic, but even in such beautiful settings animals must fight for territory and life.
Some baby predators must learn hunting from their parents, while others are deadly from the day they are born
An action-packed look at key moments in the struggles for survival and supremacy within the animal kingdom.
Tables can be turned on predators when their intended meals fight back. See how crocodiles, lions and sharks deal with these sudden reversals.

event.short_event_descriptor: Journey To The Heart of The Amazon

extended_event_descriptor.text: Prehistoric towers, waterfalls and deep canyons are surrounded here by rivers, lakes and rainforests bursting with life
From a cheetah's sprint to the struggles of a jaguar and caiman, share intimate moments in the private lives of cats
The Ngorongoro Crater contains a microcosm of African habitats, including grasslands, wetlands and forests. Meet the animals who live there.
From the tropical rainforests of the Amazon to the boreal forests in the far north, experience the greatest variety of forests in the world.
Take an epic look at the phenomenal mountain ranges of North and South America, as stunning HD pictures reveal their untamed beauty.
Tables can be turned on predators when their intended meals fight back. See how crocodiles, lions and sharks deal with these sudden reversals.
From stealthy cats to patient seals, giant centipedes and kick-boxing kangaroos, a look at animals that use stealth to their advantage.
Polar bears and giraffes are among animals fervently defending territory and mates. Sand-tiger sharks are even competitive before birth.
See animals which change colour and shape to fool or trap their enemies when they attack prey or defend themselves.
Carnivorous fish team up against a river rat, a mother bear defends her cubs by any means necessary, and killer whales live up to their name.
The Ngorongoro Crater contains a microcosm of African habitats, including grasslands, wetlands and forests. Meet the animals who live there.
Meet the planet's top carnivores. Stealthy, fierce or armed with deadly natural weapons, all have the skills to kill.
Lurking in our homes are tiny monsters feasting on human blood. Exterminators show the tactics which eliminate these rapidly multiplying pests.
Golden sands and crystalline waters may look idyllic, but even in such beautiful settings animals must fight for territory and life.
For its size, Sri Lanka is one of the most biologically diverse places on Earth. What makes its wildlife so unique?
The plains of Sri Lanka offer a wildlife spectacle to rival Africa's Serengeti. It may seem timeless, but life here faces constant changes.
Many species unique to Sri Lanka live nowhere except its central highlands, but the cloud forests are threatened by the tea trade.
Spanning the country's western length, the humid Chocó region hosts rainforests isolated by the Andes, rich in unique species.
This little-explored outcrop of sandstone comprises lush jungle, shrubland and savannah, isolated peaks, rivers and spectacular waterfalls.
Discover the natural history and secret life of the king cobra, and find out how humans hope to ensure the survival of this legendary snake.
The brute force and collective strategy of buffalo is necessary as ine breeding herd fends off relentless attack from the local lion pride.
Journey into remote parts of the Amazon rainforest to find the truth about the notorious snake. Toucans howler monkeys, and tapirs also feature.
This shrew employs echolocation like a bat and uses venom like a snake, but must also eat every two hours to stay alive.
The most dangerous creatures may not be what you think. From Bengal tigers to elephants and mosquitos, animals can kill in a multitude of ways.
Some 150 wild horses live in an expanse of desert, grassland and rock along Namibia's west coast - a 'Forbidden Zone' rife with ghost towns
Some frogs eat outsized prey alive; others are as big as a human child. Some have grotesque deformities caused by polluted waters.
Why are Africa's predators so drawn to prey that can kill them? Lions tackle huge buffalo while the honey badger hunts venomous snakes.
Some 150 wild horses live in an expanse of desert, grassland and rock along Namibia's west coast - a 'Forbidden Zone' rife with ghost towns
Some frogs eat outsized prey alive; others are as big as a human child. Some have grotesque deformities caused by polluted waters.
Equipped with deadly weapons and a bad attitude, the cobra family is feared throughout Africa and Asia. Explore their diverse abilities.
Life in Scandinavia is full of challenges. In a place this volatile and unforgiving, every creature must be prepared for the unexpected.

A look at the jaws, poison and powers of the nightmarish creatures lurking in the world's seas.

Some frogs eat outsized prey alive; others are as big as a human child. Some have grotesque deformities caused by polluted waters.
The brute force and collective strategy of buffalo is necessary as ine breeding herd fends off relentless attack from the local lion pride.
There is no greater predatory testing ground than the African Savannah. But the lion, Nile crocodile and cheetah don't always triumph.
Exotic wildlife abounds in Siberia, with its unique environment housing salamanders, camels and even the musk deer, beloved for its famous scent.
Some 150 wild horses live in an expanse of desert, grassland and rock along Namibia's west coast - a 'Forbidden Zone' rife with ghost towns
Some frogs eat outsized prey alive; others are as big as a human child. Some have grotesque deformities caused by polluted waters.
The remarkable Kevin Richardson has spent many years living surrounded by domesticated lions

See animals which change colour and shape to fool or trap their enemies when they attack prey or defend themselves.
Some baby predators must learn hunting from their parents, while others are deadly from the day they are born
Documentary about the battles between predators and their prey in the animal kingdom, as well as the conflicts which can occur within species.
Hayden goes hunting with an ancient tribe who range over an area larger than London, using blowpipes to bring down monkeys.

A show following the lives of a young cheetah mother and her first cubs as they grow from kittens into bold, powerful hunters..
These small furry animals may seem mild-mannered, but there are secret skills behind their survival in human environments.

From the deepest seas to the tallest mountains, animals prove that when it comes to Mother Nature, there's always an exception to the rule
Meet the animal world's most exceptional, including the largest, smallest, fastest, slowest - and the most toxic.
Hayden Turner joins the Baka of Cameroon, pygmies who chisel their teeth to eat prey including a huge python, and hunt with poisoned darts.
A circus lion resists captivity, open water swimmers get a surprise visit from a pair of whales, and a dog is left on the wrong side of a door.

A look at bizarre waves of animal deaths, ranging from tens of thousands of dead crabs to millions of dead fish and birds falling from the sky.
Some you see and some you don't, but they all have eight legs and bulging eyeballs. This is a nightmare of the arachnid kind.
See the goose that cheers a retiree in an LA park, a seal who won't eat without her vet, and a deer who thinks two people and a cat make a herd.
There is no greater predatory testing ground than the African Savannah. But the lion, Nile crocodile and cheetah don't always triumph.

There is no greater predatory testing ground than the African Savannah. But the lion, Nile crocodile and cheetah don't always triumph.
A journey that begins with the cat's domestication 10,000 years ago explains some of the bad behaviour of modern pets.
Experience life from dawn to dusk in the Arctic, taking in many species of the frozen North, including the Arctic fox, beluga whales and murres.
A collection of strange creatures including toads that explode, koalas with a disgusting diet, and baby birds that defend themselves by vomiting.
When humans venture into wild animals' territory, treat them too familiarly and otherwise try their patience, the results can be lethal.
Coyotes are invading towns and suburbs, attacking people and pets; their senses and wits are too sharp to make thwarting them an easy task.
Deep in the Congo, US kayakers Ben and Chris attempt to track down and capture the massive Nile crocodile that killed their friends and guide
When humans venture into wild animals' territory, treat them too familiarly and otherwise try their patience, the results can be lethal.
Coyotes are invading towns and suburbs, attacking people and pets; their senses and wits are too sharp to make thwarting them an easy task.
If it creeps, crawls or buzzes, there's a chance it could cure a major illness. Explore the untapped healing properties of unappealing animals.

Some shark species can survive in freshwater as well as salt. Zeb Hogan tries to track down the biggest and rarest Australian examples.
Thailand's giant stingrays and the whiprays of Australia are said to grow up to 16 feet and 1,300 pounds - among the biggest freshwater fish.?
There's a freshwater fish with a shock five times more powerful than a US wall socket. Zeb Hogan travels to the Amazon to catch electric eels.
Wolf fish, known locally as haimara, can reach a metre in length and are said to hunt humans. Zeb goes looking for this aggressive giant.
Greg, Ed, Brian and Chris work to install a giant pond for Tony and Shari who want a larger home for their koi fish
Greg, Ed, Brian and Chris work to install a giant pond for Tony and Shari who want a larger home for their koi fish
The team head to Lincoln Park Zoo in downtown Chicago to sort out a long-standing problem with a stagnant, leaf-choked pond.
Two massive pond projects take the team to Jacksonville, Florida. Larry Payne wants a 30-foot pond and a 2,000-pound cypress bench.
In the mountains, the team try to replicate a brown trout stream in a client's garden. In LA, they build a healing space for a cancer survivor.
Humans may create gardens but we are fortunate to share them with remarkable, and sometimes secretive, wildlife.
Footage of a lion versus cheetah fight sheds new light on the relationship between these extraordinary big cats.
The Ngorongoro Crater contains a microcosm of African habitats, including grasslands, wetlands and forests. Meet the animals who live there.

An Australian series that tells astonishing, real-life stories of deadly animal encounters
A collection of strange creatures including toads that explode, koalas with a disgusting diet, and baby birds that defend themselves by vomiting.
Odd-looking animals, startling mutations and shocking survivors take centre stage in this parade of peculiarities.
Freak encounters, unexpected assaults and killer instincts - these are meetings with animals in the wrong place at the wrong time.
Indiscriminate mating and brazen aggression show that once some animals are set off, there's no stopping them!
Giant spiders, voracious blobs and swamp things are the stuff of horror movies-but these creepy kilelrs are real
A collection of strange creatures including toads that explode, koalas with a disgusting diet, and baby birds that defend themselves by vomiting.
A look at some unusual and tiny pets, from a pint-sized squealer and a pair of naked cats to spiky creatures the size of a tea cup.
From a giant monitor lizard and a reindeer to a buffalo, meet some of the biggest pets around.
A collection of strange creatures including toads that explode, koalas with a disgusting diet, and baby birds that defend themselves by vomiting
Winter sees tourists flock to visit the Great Barrier Reef. Humpback whales make the long journey to calve in the warm tropical waters
